citations.desc: Attending veterinarian and adequate veterinary care (dealers and exhibitors).
citations.narrative:
There is no written program of veterinary care. According to the facility they have a formal arrangement with a local
veterinarian, however at the time of inspection no written program is in place and available for review.
A written program of veterinary care along with regularly scheduled visits to the premises is important for maintaining
animal health. Correct by having a written program of veterinary care in place including regularly scheduled visits by the
attending veterinarian.
Correct by March 3rd, 2023.
This is a 1st Re-License Inspection for a Class “C” license. The inspection and exit briefing were conducted with the
applicant.
All items must be in compliance within 2 more inspections, or by April 18th, 2023, or the applicant will forfeit the license
fee and must wait 6 months to reapply. Please contact your inspector to schedule your next Re-License Inspection.
Regulated activity can continue under your existing USDA license until it expires.
End Section
